availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James R. Berryman (Henry County druggist and physician)

body.p: Henry County, Kentucky, druggist and physician. Virginia native. Married to Elizabeth T. Berryman. Father of James K. Berryman, Mary A. Berryman, Catherine Berryman, Eliza Berryman, Edmund Berryman, Thomas Berryman, Joseph Berryman, and Salie Berryman. Druggist in Henry County in 1850. Physician in Henry County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Henry County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Town of New Castle, p. 3.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Town of New Castle, p. 2.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, District of New Castle, p. 8.
